Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ACG 2021 and ECO 2013 or ECO 2023 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better and consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Open to University honors students and other students participating in the honors program. With the balance sheet as a reference point, this course provides an introduction and overview of the acquisition, financing, and management of business assets. With honors level content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 3403 with a "C" (2.0) or better; open to majors or minors which require this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The role of short and long-term financial markets and financial institutions in capital formation and allocation. Theories and mathematics of interest rates.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ACG 2021 and ECO 2013 or ECO 2023 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: With the balance sheet as a reference point, this course provides an introduction and overview of the acquisition, financing, and management of business assets.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 3403 with a "B" (3.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors. Must be taken with or before FIN 4243 and FIN 4504.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: In-depth study of the principles of corporate finance. Investment, financing, and capital decisions are examined.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 3403 with a "B" (3.0) or better. Open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Course examines debt, money market investments, market structure, trading and valuation. Risk management introduced. Roles of banking systems, and financial institutions in fixed income markets.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Overview of FinTech, which involves technology innovations in the financial services sector including retail banking, investments, blockchain and crypto-currencies.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 4243 and FIN 4504, each with a "C" (2.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Mathematical models applied specifically to financial problems, including those models suitable for representation and solutions on computers.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 4243 with a "C" (2.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of the intersections of commercial banking policies and an analysis of current approaches to managing specific bank products.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Class can be taken with departmental permission ONLY. ECO 4443 and FIN 4458

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to business intelligence and analytics applied to the financial world. It includes the use of data, statistical/quantitative analysis using R, and exploratory and predictive models.

FIN4424 - Advanced Topics in Financial M.name: FIN4424 - Advanced Topics in Financial Management

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 3414, FIN 4243 and FIN 4504 each with a "C" (2.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced study in financial management. Topics include capital budgeting, financial structure, and capital decisions. Case studies used extensively.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Open to all students (majors, minors, and non-majors).

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An overview of personal and family financial planning. Topics include housing, investments, insurance, retirement planning, estate planning, financial services, consumer credit, and tax planning.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 4504 with a "C" (2.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Portfolio and capital market theory in the determination of rational investment policies. Risk analysis, portfolio analysis, and evaluation techniques.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Consent of Honors or CI. Finance major, completion of FIN 3403, FIN 4243, FIN 4504 and FIN 4560H with a "B" (3.0) or better. Class size limited, enrollment must be approved by department.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Student Managed Portfolio program with honors content. Rigorous coverage of advanced portfolio management topics, including uses of derivatives, tax issues, and style investing.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 3403 with a "B" (3.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Course examines equity investments, including market structure, trading, analysis, and valuation. Theories of efficient markets and rational investors are examined. Futures and options are introduced.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Finance major with at least 6 hours of completed coursework in finance, 3.0 Finance major GPA, minimum overall GPA of 2.75 and consent of internship coordinator.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Supervised finance work experience in a pre-approved sponsoring organization. See department for information and application.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 4504 or FIN 4243, each with a "C" (2.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Options, futures, forwards, and other derivative contracts. Investments traded in these markets are examined. Pricing and hedging are considered.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Consent of Honors or CI. Finance major, completion of FIN 3403, FIN 4243 and FIN 4504, each with a "B" (3.0) or better. Class size limited, enrollment must be approved by department.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Student Managed Portfolio program with honors content. Provides rigorous analyses of equity portfolio management topics, including risk/return, valuation, forecasting, portfolio construction, and performance appraisal.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 3403 with a "B" (3.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of the foreign financial methods and investment, currency futures market, capital budgeting, cash management, examination of Eurocurrency market and international bond markets.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FIN 3403 with a "B" (3.0) or better; open to finance majors and minors, or with department consent which will be based on meeting qualifications for finance majors and minors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Understanding and interpreting financial statement data for business decisions and valuations.
